description: From Middle English yerling, yerlyng, equivalent to year +‎ -ling. Cognate with Dutch jaarling (“yearling”), German Jährling (“yearling”).

entries.meaning: An animal that is between one and two years old; one that is in its second year (but not yet two full years old).
A racehorse that is considered to be one year old until a subsequent January 1st.
(US) A sophomore at West Point military academy.
examples: "But is a plebe forbidden to stroll here?""If a plebe did have the brass to try it," replied Anstey slowly, "I reckon he would have to fight the whole yearling class in turn."
